jobTitle: Thesis Leader, Full-Stack Developer, and Web Designer
jobDescription: I lead a team of 4 students in the development of a web-based application that allows university community to create lost and found reports of missing items and allows the admin to manage the reports.
jobActivities: Developing and deploying a system that streamlined searching, reporting, communication, and documentation by 40%
Designing and implementing RESTful APIs using Node.js and Express
Incorporated processes for creation and management of lost and found reports which helps the admins knowing who to communicate with for possible matching reports
Implemented real-time messaging with Socket.io for client inquiries towards the admins about their lost and found items and reports.

jobDescription: I lead develop and contribute to several projects, creating solutions that meet the organization's needs and transforming their concepts into a reality.
jobActivities: Developed OPFRS (Oil Palm Farmer Registry System) from scratch, used for keeping records of oil palm farmers in the Philippines.
Implement a dashboard for OPFRS that generates graphs and reports about the farmers' information that helps the admin to make decisions.
Collaborated on implementing backend solutions for IMS (Inventory Management System) with regards to PCA's item suppliers.
Refactored 50% of IMS's code base which were written by previous interns.
Contributed to developing a web version of an existing EPMS (Employee Payroll Management System), transitioning from a C# application to a ReactJS-based website.
Assisted in setting up devices and software for the Boardroom and AFB's online and face-to-face meetings.
Provided support to various departments, resolving issues related to internet connectivity and devices (printers, monitors).
Operated as the cameraman for the live-stream broadcast of PCA's 51st Anniversary on YouTube.
Played an active role in the PCA “MUSICOCO” singing contest committee, organizing and preparing the full setup at PCA's auditorium.
